title: Live briefing: Israel-Hezbollah cease-fire appears to hold amid violation accusations
content: The Lebanese army said Israel violated the cease-fire agreement, while the IDF said it was responding to violations by Hezbollah.
summary: The Lebanese army said Israel violated the cease-fire agreement, while the IDF said it was responding to violations by Hezbollah.

title: Mexico shuts watchdog agencies, intensifying fears for its democracy
content: President Claudia Sheinbaum says the agencies were unnecessary. Critics call their dissolution a power grab by the ruling party.
summary: President Claudia Sheinbaum says the agencies were unnecessary. Critics call their dissolution a power grab by the ruling party.

title: U.K. backs assisted dying law, as more countries consider legalization
content: Palliative care expert Nancy Preston said interest increased during the pandemic, when people witnessed the sorts of deaths they want to avoid for themselves.
summary: Palliative care expert Nancy Preston said interest increased during the pandemic, when people witnessed the sorts of deaths they want to avoid for themselves.

title: Restored Notre Dame unveiled with grand tour led by Macron
content: The televised tour is the first look inside the revamped cathedral since the 2019 fire that put it at risk of collapse.
summary: The televised tour is the first look inside the revamped cathedral since the 2019 fire that put it at risk of collapse.

title: Could you feed yourself on $70 a month? Chinese millennials are trying.
content: The cost of living is weighing on consumers everywhere. But some Chinese, worried about making ends meet in a slowing economy, are taking this food-spending challenge.
summary: The cost of living is weighing on consumers everywhere. But some Chinese, worried about making ends meet in a slowing economy, are taking this food-spending challenge.

Chinese journalist and former Harvard fellow sentenced to 7 years
content: Dong Yuyu’s conviction on espionage charges shows how the space for independent thought and open discussion in China has narrowed since Xi Jinping took power in 2012.

title: Can you stop a teen from using TikTok? Australia is about to find out.
content: Australia passed a law banning children under 16 from using social media apps like TikTok and Snapchat. Whether it can be enforced remains in question.
summary: Australia passed a law banning children under 16 from using social media apps like TikTok and Snapchat. Whether it can be enforced remains in question.

title: Mexico’s president has ‘excellent’ talk with Trump, dismisses tariff threat
content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum spoke to President-elect Donald Trump after he threatened to impose tariffs and she hinted at retaliation in a letter.
summary: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum spoke to President-elect Donald Trump after he threatened to impose tariffs and she hinted at retaliation in a letter.

title: Russia rains missiles on Ukraine after Trump names new envoy to conflict
content: There was a cautious note of optimism among some Ukrainians for retired Gen. Keith Kellogg’s past supportive remarks for Ukraine to defend itself.

title: After Lebanon cease-fire, Israeli families hope for hostage deal
content: Hostage families are pushing the Biden administration and the Trump transition team to help secure the release of their loved ones.

title: Rare footprints suggest two of our prehistoric ancestors may have met
content: The footprints are the first clear evidence that the two hominin species shared a habitat, raising questions about whether their interactions shaped human evolution.
summary: The footprints are the first clear evidence that the two hominin species shared a habitat, raising questions about whether their interactions shaped human evolution.

title: Israeli strikes test cease-fire; IDF warns displaced Lebanese not to return
content: Israeli tank and artillery fire struck several villages, Lebanon’s state media reported, as the Israeli military warned civilians not to return to the area.
summary: Israeli tank and artillery fire struck several villages, Lebanon’s state media reported, as the Israeli military warned civilians not to return to the area.

title: Missing hiker found alive after 50 days in Canadian wilderness
content: Sam Benastick, 20, went missing after going on a solo camping trip in a remote park in the Rocky Mountains. Police suspended the search operation in late October.
summary: Sam Benastick, 20, went missing after going on a solo camping trip in a remote park in the Rocky Mountains. Police suspended the search operation in late October.

title: Three Americans wrongfully detained in China released in prisoner swap
content: Americans Mark Swidan, Kai Li and John Leung would soon be reunited with their families in the United States after years in prison in China, the White House said.

title: Photos show record-breaking South Korea snowfall
content: Seoul on Thursday saw its heaviest November snowfall in more than 100 years, as traffic snarled and flights ground to a halt.

title: Women despair over Taliban rules, but many Afghan returnees don’t see it
content: Afghans living abroad are flocking back to visit relatives for the first time since the Taliban takeover. Draconian restrictions on women are not top of mind.
